business.headline: Health insurance: 4 tips to reduce premiums for senior citizens Purchasing a health insurance policy at a younger age can help in securing reduced premium rates. Generally, lower insurance premiums are offered to younger people as they are considered low risk.

Index Funds vs. ETFs: 5 key things every investor should know Exchange-Traded Funds are traded like shares on the stock market and can be sold or purchased at existing market prices during the day, while Index Funds are traded only once at the closure of the share market.

ICMAI demands 'accountant' status for cost accountants in new Income Tax BillIn its memorandum, ICMAI highlighted the extensive training of Cost and Management Accountants (CMAs), which includes expertise in taxation, finance, auditing, corporate laws, and strategic risk management.

New tax regime: 3 deductions that can help taxpayers maximise savings  Though the new regime offered concessional tax rates, it reduced several popular deductions and exemptions, like HRA, LTA, interest on home loans, Section 80C, and more.

AI to take centre stage at the 3rd Digital News Publishers Association ConclaveThrough various keynote sessions, panel discussions and expert presentations, this year's DNPA Conclave aims to decode various critical issues, future strategies, opportunities and models that can power an equitable, inclusive and sustainable digital media ecosystem in an era of rapid technological advancement.
AMFI launches Chhoti SIP, Tarun Yojana, and MITRA. All you need to knowThe latest initiative by AMFI reinforces its goal of making mutual fund investments accessible to all investors across India.

Sensex, Nifty end lower for another session; auto stocks tumbleThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 424.90 points to 75,311.06 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 117.25 points to settle at 22,795.90.

Explained: What are 'high-conviction stocks' and why investors should track themHigh-conviction stocks are shares that investors, analysts, or fund managers strongly believe will deliver higher-than-average returns.

8th Pay Commission: When will it be formed? A look at the past trendsA Pay Commission recommends changes to the salary structure, allowances and benefits to be offered to employees depending upon the prevailing economic structure.

Explained: Why M&M share price tumbled 6% todayThe stock tumbled after the company said it will put money into a rights issue for its two subsidiaries—Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services (MMFSL) and Mahindra Lifespace Developers (MLDL).

Worried about volatile stock market? Check these 10 potential multibagger stocksThe most important factor for determining multibagger stocks is to check earnings and growth potential. Investors should seek stocks that consistently deliver revenue and profit, check metrics like PE ratio and dividend yield, and compare their performance with sectoral or broader market trends.

Planning to start SIP? 2 reasons why you should consider NPSBy investing in NPS, individuals can claim tax benefits of up to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C and an additional Rs 50,000 under Section 80CCD (1B).

entertainment.headline: Watch: Honey Singh kicks off Millionaire tour with a grand Mumbai showRapper Honey Singh launched his Millionaire Tour with a spectacular concert in Mumbai. The show featured dramatic entrances and a lineup of energetic performances.

Undercover High School X review: Fans give thumbs up to Seo Kang-joon's K-dramaUndercover High School, featuring Seo Kang-joon and Jin Ki-joo, has premiered on MBC TV. The series, praised for its engaging storyline, follows an undercover NIS agent as a high school student.

Rapper Diddy's attorney withdraws from case: Under no circumstances can I continueAnthony Ricco, representing Sean 'Diddy' Combs, has filed to withdraw from the federal case citing reasons protected by attorney-client privilege. Ricco had once defended Osama bin Laden.

Buried Hearts review: Park Hyung-sik commands attention in his darkest roleReleased-Sat Feb 22, 2025The Korean drama Buried Hearts will captivate viewers with its blend of intense emotions and high-stakes drama. The series, featuring Park Hyung-sik, explores the complex dynamics of corporate intrigue and personal survival. Read the full review.

Rakhi Sawant reacts to summons: I'm poor, not criminal - focus on rape casesRakhi Sawant was summoned by the Maharashtra cyber cell to record her statement regarding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's controversial remarks on Samay Raina's show, 'India's Got Latent'. She urged the police to focus on solving pending rape cases instead of treating her like a criminal.

Zero Day: Critics praise Robert De Niro, criticise show's 'incoherent politics'Critics have mixed reactions to Robert De Niro's latest Netflix series, Zero Day. While many have praised De Niro, a section of them are unhappy with the narrative of the show.

Grammy-nominated band OneRepublic unites with Karan Aujla for new song Tell MeGlobal pop-rock sensation OneRepublic is collaborating with Punjabi artist Karan Aujla for a new track titled Tell Me. It will release on February 27.

Mismatched actor Prajakta Koli to marry boyfriend on February 25: ReportActor Prajakta Koli is set to marry her boyfriend Vrishank Khanal on February 25. Their wedding festivities will begin on February 23.

Crime Beat review: Rahul Bhat, Saqib Saleem's crime drama gets lost in its own chaosReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025'Crime Beat', a political thriller, premiered on Zee5 on February 21. Based on the book titled 'The Price You Pay', the show falls short due to outdated tropes and exaggerated clichés.

Honey Singh says he's a great cook, reveals his favourite dishRapper and music producer Yo Yo Honey Singh opens up about his favourite cuisine, his cooking skills and more in an exclusive interaction with us.

From heartfelt to hilarious, in praise of Park Bo-young's versatilityKorean star Park Bo-young has been acting for almost two decades now. Her ability to completely inhabit the skin of her characters makes her truly stand out. She is currently seen in Melo Movie, which is streaming on Netflix.

Honey Singh on his Mumbai concert: Doing something I've never done beforeRapper Honey Singh is starting his countrywide tour from Mumbai on Saturday. In an exclusive interview with us, the singer talked about the gig and what he's doing differently this time at 'Millionaire India Tour at Stage Aajtak'.

Kangana Ranaut's Emergency to premiere on Netflix. Check release dateKangana Ranaut's film, Emergency, is going to hit the screens next month. The actor shared a quick announcement in her Instagram stories on Friday.

Robin Tunney marks 10 years since The Mentalist finale, thanks fan for their loveActor Robin Tunney celebrated the 10th anniversary of The Mentalist finale, expressing gratitude to fans for their unwavering support. She also reflected on the show's impact on her life and career.

Atif Aslam's surprise street performance in London leaves fans in disbelief. WatchSinger Atif Aslam's video of him performing on a London street has emerged online. This surprise clip has left many fans in disbelief.

Honey Singh Millionaire tour: Reasons why it's unlike any otherYo Yo Honey Singh is set to electrify Mumbai with his high-energy performance as part of the Stage Tak Millionaire tour, promising an unforgettable night of music and nostalgia. Here are a few reasons why one should not miss it.

Nobody Wants This 2: What is Leighton Meester playing in husband Adam Brody's show?Netflix renewed 'Nobody Wants This' for season 2 last year, and now actor Leighton Meester, known for playing Blair Waldorf in 'Gossip Girl', has joined the show. Her husband, actor Adam Brody, plays the lead character, Noah, in the series.

Comic Varun Grover's sharp take on Ranveer Allahbadia, censorship and BeerBicepsComedian-lyricist Varun Grover recently took a jibe at the recent controversy surrounding podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia's appearance on India's Got Latent.

BB 18's Alice Kaushik, Tajinder Bagga, others reunite at Arfeen-Sara's Goa bashBigg Boss 18 contestants, including Alice Kaushik, Tajinder Bagga, and Nyrraa Banerjii reunited to celebrate Sara and Arfeen Khan's anniversary in Goa.

Dhanashree Verma's cryptic post amid divorce rumours: From stressed to blessedDhanashree Verma recently shared a cryptic message on social media, suggesting a shift from 'stressed to blessed'. This comes amid swirling rumours of a possible divorce with cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal.

TV actor Dipika Kakar Ibrahim quits Celebrity MasterChef amid health concernsPopular TV actor Dipika Kakar Ibrahim has withdrawn from Celebrity MasterChef due to health issues. Despite the show's support, she prioritised her well-being over the competition.

Rapper-singer Honey Singh arrives in Mumbai for sold-out concertHoney Singh is in Mumbai for the much-anticipated Stage AajTak Millionaire concert this Saturday, February 22. With a fantastic set list, the sold-out show promises a night full of magic and madness.

Jisoo, Seo In-guk to star in Netflix's next show on virtual datingJisoo and Seo In-guk are joining hands for an upcoming Netflix drama, Boyfriend on Demand. The show will explore virtual reality dating.
The Last Of Us Part 2 release date announced The Last Of Us Part 2's release date has been announced. The Pedro Pascal show is all set to stream on Prime Video from April 13.

Is Eminem finally coming to India? Rapper's leaked schedule hints soLeaked documents have suggested that Eminem will perform in Mumbai in June 2025 as part of his world tour. The rapper's first visit to India is stirring excitement among fans.
Iconic TV show CID now streaming on NetflixCID on Netflix: The iconic Indian crime series CID is now available on Netflix, allowing fans worldwide to stream the popular show.

Will Prime Video's Jack Reacher ever visit India? Author Lee Child speaksAuthor Lee Child, whose Reacher books have inspired a series on Prime Video, spoke to India Today Digital, about the possibility of seeing his leading character travelling to India in the future.

Vlogger Shenaz Treasury reveals losing a brand deal after Ranveer Allahbadia row Former actor and influencer Shenaz Treasury recently shared how she lost a brand deal after Ranveer Allahbadia's controversy.

Nadaaniyan: Ibrahim Ali Khan explains love to Miss Briganza; release date outNetflix on Thursday announced the release date of Ibrahim Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor's 'Nadaaniyan'. The film is a Gen-Z love story and is set in Delhi-Noida.

Palak Muchhal on timeless appeal of Sanam Teri Kasam title song: It's magicalSanam Teri Kasam's title track is topping the music charts. Singer Palak Muchhal calls it surreal, recalls recording it, and hints at a new version. She also discusses Amitabh Bachchan's praise and the evolving music industry.

They'll just ask Samay Raina to write a 300-word essay: Comic mocks outrageComedian Daniel Fernandes mocked the outrage over Samay Raina's controversy, joking that he'd only need to write a "300-word essay." He also criticised calls to ban India's Got Latent.

Rihanna, A$AP Rocky to name next baby after lawyer who helped win caseIn a statement, A$AP Rocky's lawyer revealed that the rapper and his long-time partner Rihanna jokingly promised to name their next child after him. A$AP Rocky was found not guilty in a felony assault trial.

Aashram 3 part 2 trailer: Bobby Deol is back as the menacing Baba NiralaAshram Season 3, Part 2 trailer: The much-awaited Aashram returns with Part 2 of Season 3, directed by Prakash Jha. The new season delves into themes of power, betrayal, and revenge.

Melo Movie review: A slow-burn, mature drama that will stay with youReleased-Fri Feb 14, 2025Melo Movie released in Netflix on February 14. Starring Choi Woo-shik and Park Bo-young, the 10-episode-show deals with love, loss, and grief.

New Matthew Perry documentary promises to dig deep into the Hollywood tragedyA new Matthew Perry documentary called Matthew Perry: A Hollywood Tragedy will be out later this month, wherein the makers will investigate the untimely death of the Friends star.

The First Frost review: Love, trauma, longing - new Chinese drama delivers it all Released-Thu Feb 20, 2025The First Frost review: This Chinese drama delves into the complexities of love, trauma, and longing, offering a poignant narrative that diverges from typical romance tropes. With its melancholic visuals and dual perspectives, it explores the tangled history between its protagonists, making it a compelling watch.

Uorfi Javed's mother on her bold fashion: Was shocked at first, but I support herUorfi Javed revealed her mother was the first in their family to try Botox. Her mother also recalled her reaction when she saw Uorfi's "new style".

Suzhal 2 trailer: Kathir takes on gripping murder mystery with Aishwarya RajeshThe official trailer of the highly-anticipated second season of the Tamil crime thriller Suzhal - The Vortex was released on Wednesday. Starring Kathir and Aishwarya Rajesh in lead roles, the series will premiere on Prime Video on February 28.

Rihanna 'thankful, humbled' after A$AP Rocky found not guilty in shooting caseA$AP Rocky was declared not guilty in a felony assault trial, leading to an emotional embrace with Rihanna in court. After the verdict, the singer issued her first statement, expressing relief.

Retro hits to soulful music: Magical evening at Papon's Valentine's Day special showPapon's concert in Delhi, hosted by TV9, was an unforgettable night filled with soulful music. Held at Major Dhyan Chand National Stadium, the event was part of the World Travel and Tourism Festival.

general news.headline: Former RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das appointed Principal Secretary to PMFormer IAS officer PK Mishra is currently serving as the first Principal Secretary to the Prime Minister since September 11, 2019. Former RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das will now serve as the second Principal Secretary.

Washington Post counters Trump's India funding claim, Congress gets fresh ammoThe Washington Post, quoting US officials familiar with USAID programs, said USAID had a $21 million contract for Bangladesh.

1 dead in France knife attack, Emmanuel Macron calls it 'Islamist terrorism'One person was killed and three others, including two police officers, were wounded in a knife attack during a demonstration in eastern France. President Macron called it an Islamist terror act. The suspect, 37, was on a terror watchlist.

Indian anthem played in Lahore before Australia vs England in organisers' blunderChampions Trophy 2025: The Indian national anthem was played by mistake before England and Australia met at Lahore's Gaddafi Stadium on Saturday. India are not playing any of their games in Pakistan.

India vs Pakistan: What used to be a fierce rivalry is just a memory nowChampions Trophy 2025: The template of India-Pakistan cricket has become predictable. India gets beaten only when it has a rare off day. But, Pakistan loses even when it has a great day. Meaning? In closely fought games, India always wins.

Pope Francis not out of danger, very little to become unbalanced: DoctorPope Francis, 88, remains in critical condition after a severe respiratory crisis, requiring oxygen and blood transfusions. Doctors warn of sepsis risk. He remains alert but in pain. Vatican events continue without him as his recovery remains uncertain.

Driver dead, 15 injured as bus from Vaishno Devi falls into gorge in JammuAll 17 passengers on the bus were immediately rushed to the Government Medical College in Jammu, according to police officials. The condition of the injured is stable, officials further said.

FIR filed in Himachal 'samosa row', claims CID confidential docs leaked in publicAn FIR was filed by Himachal Pradesh Police against unknown persons over the 'samosa controversy', alleging that confidential documents of the CID were leaked in public, and tarnished the image of the agency and the state government.

Filming war right: What Chhaava could have learnt from Jodhaa Akbar, Bajirao MastaniChhaava, led by Vicky Kaushal, delivers relentless, violent war sequences that lack emotional depth, making battles exhausting rather than engaging. Unlike Bajirao Mastani and Jodhaa Akbar, which balanced spectacle with storytelling, Chhaava overwhelms with its brutal scenes.

LPU's 2025 Batch Final Year Student Bags Rs 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) Placement Package-Betireddy Naga Vamsi Reddy B. Tech student has secured a 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) package with an AI robotics company and is set to graduate in May 2025. 

-Over 1,700 students have received packages ranging from Rs 10 LPA – Rs 1 Crore per annum 

-1,912 students received multiple job offers while Adireddy Vasu, secured 7 job offers, setting a rare and impressive record.

Trump says will impose reciprocal tariffs on India 'soon' days after meeting PMDays after meeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Washington DC, US President Donald Trump said he will "soon" impose reciprocal tariffs on countries such as India and China.

At least 8 workers feared trapped after roof of tunnel in Telangana collapsesThe accident occurred due to the slippage of a concrete segment that was used to seal seepage at the 14-km inlet of the tunnel in Telangana's Nagarkurnool district.

X user asks Anand Mahindra to gift Thar to FBI director Kash Patel. See his responseIn a post on X, Anand Mahindra shared a picture of Kash Patel with the caption: "Kash Patel, new Director of the FBI. Doesn't look like you can mess with this guy. Mind it."

Yuzvendra Chahal, Dhanshree file for divorce, dancer's family deny alimony rumoursIndia cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and his wife Dhanashree Verma have filed for divorce after months of speculation around their separation. Dhanashree's family has also denied reports of her asking for alimony.

Nationalists respect each other: Jaishankar on PM-Trump bonhomieS Jaishankar praised the strong rapport between PM Modi and the US President, emphasising mutual nationalist respect and highlighting PM Modi's early invitation to Washington during Donald Trump's second term.

Josh Inglis hundred trumps Duckett's 165 in Australia's historic run-chase Champions Trophy: Josh Inglis' 77-ball hundred helped Australia chase down 352 and beat Jos Buttler's England by five wickets on Saturday in front of a sold-out crowd at the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore.
Not just Maha Kumbh, how spiritual tourism is taking Indians abroadExperts believe that Maha Kumbh has put India firmly on the global map of spiritual tourism.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Express train breaks down due to engine issue in Odisha, ops resume after 3 hoursThe New Jalpaiguri-Chennai Express broke down after it hit an electric pole in Odisha's Balasore district. An official cited a locomotive issue and there were no reports of casualties so far.

Funds for reviving Uttarakhand forests used to buy iPhones, laptops: Audit reportThe CAG report, presented during the Uttarakhand Budget session, revealed that for the 2019-2022 period, Rs 13.86 crore was diverted for purposes unrelated to afforestation.

Maharashtra halts bus services to Karnataka after attack by pro-Kannada activistsMaharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) bus, which was plying from Bengaluru to Mumbai, was attacked in Chitradurga in Karnataka on Friday night by pro-Kannada activists.

Hamas releases 6 more Israeli hostages as fragile Gaza ceasefire deal holds onOf the six hostages freed, Eliya Cohen, 27, Omer Shem Tov, 22, and Omer Wenkert, 23, were kidnapped by Hamas from the site of the Nova music festival in southern Israel during the group's October 7, 2023 attack.

WPL 2025: Chinelle Henry, bowlers help UP Warriorz thrash Delhi Capitals by 33 runsUP Warriorz registered their first win of the Women's Premier League 2025 beating Delhi Capitals by 33 runs in Match 8 in Bengaluru. Chinelle Henry was adjudged Player of the Match for her game-changing innings of 62 (23).

Punjab minister ran 'non-existent' department for 20 months, BJP roasts AAPThe Punjab government's decision to scrap the "non-existent" Department of Administrative Reforms came as part of a major administrative overhaul, which also saw the transfer of 21 IPS officers.

Andrew Garfield dating A Complete Unknown actor Monica Barbaro: ReportAndrew Garfield is reportedly dating Monica Barbaro of Top Gun Maverick fame. The couple was seen attending a play in London's West End, sparking rumors of them dating.

Kunal Kemmu on Saif Ali Khan's stabbing: I broke this news to SohaActor Kunal Kemmu opened up about the shocking incident involving Saif Ali Khan's stabbing. He shared his family's initial reactions and thoughts on celebrities safety.

Yash aka Ravana in Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana begins shoot in Mumbai: ReportActor Yash has commenced filming for Ramayana in Mumbai, taking on the role of Ravana in the film, as per reports. The current schedule focusses on a grand war sequence, but Ramnbir Kapoor will not be joining him.

Tom Holland's Spider-Man 4 postponed to avoid clash with Nolan's The OdysseySony Pictures has announced a new release date for Tom Holland's upcoming Spider-Man movie, now set for July 31, 2026. This change aligns the film's release shortly after Christopher Nolan's The Odyssey, also starring Holland.

sports.headline: 17-year-old Mirra Andreeva becomes youngest-ever WTA 1000 champion Mirra Andreeva beat Clara Tauson 7-6 (1), 6-1 in the final of the Dubai Tennis Championships on Saturday, February 22, to become the youngest-ever WTA 1000 champion at the age of 17.

Chinelle Henry was adjudged Player of the Match for her game-changing innings of 62 (23).

Who said what after Josh Inglis helped Australia secure record win vs EnglandJosh Inglis was the star of the show as he helped Australia script a historic win in the Champions Trophy on Staurday, February 22. Inglis' 120 ultimately eclipsed a sensational performance from Ben Duckett with the bat for England.

No extra advantage for India in Dubai, we need to play with coverage: Aqib JavedPakistan bowling coach Aqib Javed said that India won't be having any extra advantage playing in Dubai and mentioned that his team will play with courage in the all-important clash between the two teams on Sunday, February 23.

How Rawalpindi weather forecast adds more pressure to Pakistan before India gameThe weather forecast for Rawalpindi on February 27 is all set to add more pressure to Pakistan ahead of their crucial game against India on Sunday. Pakistan will be facing Bangladesh on February 27 in Rawalpindi.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
